page.title: 13ST. MATHEWS CHURCH_COATES
page.content: {ST.MATHEW'S CHURCH - COATES.} THE CHURCH IS THOUGHT TO HAVE BEEN BUILT ON THE SITE OF THE DOMESDAY CHAPEL. THE FIRST RECTOR WAS ROBERT IN 1221.THE INSIDE HAS EXAMPLES OF NORMAN AND EARLY ENGLISH WORK INCLUDING A NORMAN FONT AND A RICH TREFOILED PISCINA OF THE 13TH CENTURY. OUTSIDE THERE ARE THREE MASS DIALS,ONE SAXON, A 14TH CENTURY TOWER IN THREE STAGES AND AN ANTHROPOPHAGUS.THERE IS ONLY ONE OTHER SPECIMEN IN GLOUCESTERSHIRE. THE RECTOR IS THE REV.R.A.BOWDEN. { {SMERILL FARM MUSEUM - 1978.} A COLLECTION THAT STARTED AS A HOBBY IN 1951 IS NOW SET OUT TO SHOW WHAT THE FARMYARDS OF YESTERYEAR WERE LIKE WITH FARM MACHINERY, A FULLY EQUIPED DAIRY,COUNTRY CLOTHES,HOUSEHOLD GOODS AND CHILDREN'S TOYS. ANIMALS AND POULTRY WANDER FREELY.
